fields.value: ABC News Clinton Economy Speech Poll, February 1993

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This special topic poll monitored public opinion on   President Bill Clinton's televised speech on the economy, delivered   February 15, 1993. Respondents rated their approval of Clinton's   speech, and indicated whether they had a good idea of where Clinton   planned to lead the nation in the next four years, whether Clinton   was headed in the right direction in his plans for dealing with the   economy, and whether they agreed that Americans were going to have to   make some financial sacrific
es for the long-term good of the nation's   economy. Those surveyed were also asked if they thought most   Americans were ready to make such sacrifices, and if they personally   would be willing to accept a $100-a-year increase in their taxes to   help reduce the federal budget deficit. Background information on  respondents includes political party, household income, and sex.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIV.C.1. Mass Political Behavior and Attitudes, Public Opinion on Political Matters, United States

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: Persons aged 18 and over living in households with  telephones in the 48 contiguous United States.

fields.value: Households were selected by random digit dialing. Within   households, the respondent selected was the adult living in the   household who last had a birthday and who was at home at the time of  the interview.
